title: Narendra Modi, ‘Swacch Bharat Abhiyan’ mocked by Haryana minister Krishan Kumar Bedi
text:
Narendra Modi, ‘Swacch Bharat Abhiyan’ mocked by Haryana minister Krishan Kumar Bedi By India.com Staff on October 11, 2015 at 11:52 PM Comments 
It has been more than a year since Narendra Modi kickstarted ‘Swacch Bharat Abhiyan’, a cleanliness drive which was aimed at improving the shambolic sanitation levels in India. Since the mission kicked off, there have been plenty of people jumping the bandawagon; some out of genuine interest, religious followers of Narendra Modi and the BJP, some for publicity and there is the other lot, for whom it is simply a chore. That is how it seems for Haryana minister Krishan Kumar Bedi, who was present at a rally. 
Initially oblivious to reporters and the camera, Bedi is overheard saying “Look at the thing we are forced to do under the Prime Minister’s regime”. He is seen chuckling about the issue and with a hint of concern in his voice, enquires the cameraman if the video has been taped. Modi and his mission has had detractors with questions posed against the funds allotted for ’Swacch Bharat Abhiyan’ (65 crores). There was a promise from the Prime Minister to build more temples than toilets but the pace at which that has progressed has also come under the scanner. 
Bedi sums up the attitude of a large politicians choosing to be involved with Modi’s plea though; they want to enjoy the fame and adulation that comes with it, are happy to pose for photos with a broomstick but snigger at the very thought of a clean India.
